data: Small ceramic incense table/burner, consisting of a shallow circular cup or basin (diam. 12.7 cm) on a circular pedestal foot (diam. 7.5 cm). The basin has a relief rim. Text is incised on the flat upper surface of the table. The object is recomposed of several fragments.
The text is incised pre-firing in a clockwise direction around the upper surface of the basin in a single line.

Letters incised with a relatively broad tool, in single strokes without serfis, but with some extensions to strokes, e.g. at top of alpha. Alpha has straight bar. Epsilon has slightly shorter mid-stroke. Nu has diagonal starting and finishing part way down the verticals. Omicron and theta are slightly smaller than other characters. mu has straight lines, with the middle strokes joining slightly above the base line.
Later fourth or earlier third century BCE on the basis of the lettering (Brugnone). The type of incense burner has a long chronological span, and archaeological context is lacking.
From the necropolis in Manicalunga, Selinunte, but without more specific provenance. Identified in the museum store during restoration work..
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana
Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.
Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo
Luoghi di vendita e santuari: a proposito di un incensiere iscritto da Selinunte

Antonietta Brugnone, «Luoghi di vendita e santuari: a proposito di un incensiere iscritto da Selinunte», in Munus Laetitiae. Studi miscellanei offerti a Maria Letizia Lazzarini, vol. 1, 2 voll. (Rome: Sapienza Universita Editrice, 2018), 55–75
ἐπίθυε ἐπ’ ἐμοὶ τᾶι Ἀθαναίαι τύχαι ἀγαθᾶι · ἐσχάριον

1ἐπ̣[ί]θυε ἐπ’ ἐμοὶ τᾶι Ἀθαναίαι τύχαι ἀ<γα>θᾶι · ἐσ̣(χάριον?)

1Ε.[.]ΘΥΕΕΠΕΜΟΙΤΑΙΑΘΑΝΑΙΑΙΤΥΧΑΙΑΘΑΙΕ.

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after Brugnone 2018, checked against photograph ;
  • 1: Brugnone: ἐπ[ι]θυε ... ἐσ(χαρίς or χάριον)

English translation

Burn on me to Athena. To good fortune. An incense burner(?).

Italian translation

Brucia su di me ad Athena. Alla buona fortuna. Incensiere(?)

commentary

Brugnone notes that ἐσχαρίς would also be possible (but also ἐσχάρα?). The final sigma is invisible in the published photograph; Brugnone (2018: 56) notes that 'dopo l'epsilon si intravede un sigma che sembra inciso dopo la cottura con una punta sottile', and suggests the two letters, following a mark of separation, stand as abbreviation for the object itself.

bibliography

  • Brugnone 2018 55-68, figs. 1-6 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002780
